business.headline: Why middle-class Indians prefer Dubai to India for buying property, explains CAIn Dubai, many middle-class Indian couples have managed to purchase two to three properties by saving meticulously over the years. These properties, which offer rental yields of 6–7%, are financed at an interest rate of just 5%, creating sustainable assets that serve as both income sources and retirement plans.

Oman becomes first Gulf nation to introduce income tax from 2028The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has already hinted that other Gulf nations may eventually need to introduce income tax too, especially as global demand for fossil fuels continues to decline.

Sensex ends 158 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Adani Ports down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 158.32 points to close at 82,055.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 72.45 points to end at 25,044.35.
Stock market down 1%: Why did Sensex, Nifty fall after early gains?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 261.25 points to 82,158.04, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 96.85 points to 25,068.75 as of 2:33 pm.

Labubu mania: How a quirky doll made Pop Mart a global giantAt the heart of this success is Pop Mart's 38-year-old founder Wang Ning, now one of China's top 10 richest people. As of June 2025, he's worth $22.7 billion, all thanks to Labubu.

Adani AGM 2025: Gautam Adani denies US bribery charges, asserts group's clean recordAhead of its AGM, Adani Airports Holdings Limited (AAHL) on Tuesday confirmed securing $1 billion in project finance for Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which operates the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA).

Your CTC is lying to you: CA points out salary details most people overlookThe post is part caution and part financial literacy reminder. It challenges employees to take ownership of their earnings and not just celebrate the illusion of a big CTC.

Explained: Why are oil sector stocks rising today?The ceasefire announcement made by US President Donald Trump triggered a decline in oil prices, which had experienced a prior surge due to geopolitical tensions.

Explained: Why Enviro Infra Engineers share price jumped 11% in early tradeAt around 9:48 am, the company's stock was trading at Rs 233.50 apiece on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), up 10.43% from the previous close.

Sensex jumps 900 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At around 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 869.86 points at 82,766.65, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 262.75 points to 25,234.65. Broader markets also mirrored the upbeat sentiment, with volatility declining across the board.
Sensex jumps 800 points. Nifty goes past 25,200; Adani Ports up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 576.42 points to 82,473.21, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 194.05 points to 25,165.95 as of 9:35 am.

Sensex and Nifty to open higher as Iran-Israel ceasefire eases oil pricesThe Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,297.50 as of 8:10 a.m., indicating that the Nifty50 will open above its previous close of 24,971.9.

Stocks to watch today: Dixon Tech, Enviro Infra, Tata Motors, Adani EnergyThe benchmark indices fell over half a percent on Monday. However, reports suggesting a possible ceasefire between Iran and Israel could help bring some stability to the market.
Israel-Iran conflict: Will Iran's threat to close the Hormuz Strait affect India?This episode of the Super 6 programme discusses the potential impact on India if Iran closes the Strait of Hormuz.

From Rs 1 crore to Rs 25 lakh: How inflation quietly shrinks your wealthUnderstanding the impact of inflation on wealth and the necessity of strategic investing to preserve financial security over time.
90% lose in real estate, expert explains what the top 1% do insteadA real estate advisor explains why the majority of buyers in India are not profiting from real estate, while a select few succeed.
Sensex ends 511 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,000; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 511.38 points to close at 81,896.79, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 140.50 points to end at 24,971.90.

Still earning 2.75% in your savings account? Here's a smarter optionLiquid funds serve as the middle ground between a savings account and fixed deposits, but with more flexibility and usually better returns. Over the past one and three years, liquid funds have delivered average annualised returns of 7.3% and 7%, respectively.

3 IPOs to open tomorrow: Check details of Kalpataru, Ellenbarrie, Globe CivilThe combined size of these IPOs stands at over Rs 2,500 crore, and all three are expected to list on the stock exchanges on July 1.

Explained: Why many low-income Indian households still rely on moneylendersDespite rising financial access, millions of Indian households still rely on informal loans. Gaps in formal credit, especially for low-income and self-employed borrowers, keep moneylenders relevant and often unavoidable.

Rs 6 lakh in taxes on a Rs 13 lakh car? CA reveals the hidden costUpgrading or buying a new car used to be a moment of joy for many middle-class families, but today, it's overshadowed by the heavy financial pressure it brings.

Will Iran close Hormuz Strait? What it means for oil prices in India and worldThe Strait of Hormuz is a narrow waterway connecting the Persian Gulf with the Arabian Sea. It is one of the most important oil transport routes in the world. Nearly 20% of all global crude oil passes through this strait.

Debt disguised as achievement: Financial expert on India's deepening EMI trapA rising income shouldn't come at the cost of peace of mind. Financial freedom means having choices, not just things. And that starts with avoiding EMIs that quietly chip away at your future.

Filing ITR? 5 common errors in pre-filled forms and how to fix itA pre-filled Income Tax Return (ITR) form is a partially completed form provided by the Income Tax Department to make filing easier for taxpayers. These forms are automatically filled with details taken from trusted sources such as your PAN, Aadhaar, Form 16, and bank data from Form 26AS and the AIS.

Explained: How to vacation without the financial hangoverA dream vacation should leave you with great memories, not months of financial stress. With a little planning, you can enjoy the trip and return home without breaking your budget.

Stock markets slide amid US-Iran tensions: Buy the dip or wait it out?The Nifty 50 fell 257.25 points to 24,855.15, and the BSE Sensex was down 863.78 points to 81,544.39 as of 9:49 am. Broader indices mirrored the decline, with both mid- and small-cap indices slipping sharply.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At around 9:19 am, the BSE Sensex was down 580 points, trading at 81,828.11, while the NSE Nifty50 fell over 175 points to 24,937.25. Broader market indices mirrored the slide, and volatility indicators jumped sharply, signalling a bumpy trading session ahead.
Sensex, Nifty sink in early trade as US-Iran conflict rattles investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 791.58 points to 81,616.59, while the NSE Nifty lost 244.25 points to 24,868.15 as of 9:53 am.

Arisinfra Solutions IPO allotment out: Here's how to check status and latest GMPInvestors who took part in the public issue can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the official registrar for the IPO, Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to crash today after US attack on Iran?The Gift Nifty futures, as of 8:10 am, were trading at 25,015, indicating a lower opening compared to the previous close of 25,112.4. Benchmark indices rose about 1.6% last week, driven by gains in financial stocks, which provided some cushion against the geopolitical tensions.

Stocks to watch on June 23: TCS, Waree Renewable, HAL, BEL, MakeMyTripReports suggest the United States may have bombed a nuclear facility in Iran, triggering fresh concerns over the conflict with Israel. These developments could impact market sentiment on Dalal Street at the start of the week.

Why India may not feel the heat if Iran closes Strait of HormuzIndia, which has traditionally sourced its oil from the Middle East and more recently from Russia, is unlikely to see a major impact on its energy reserves if Iran decides to shut down the vital oil corridor of the Strait of Hormuz.

Generative AI must pay for using copyright content, says DNPAThe Digital News Publishers Association said it "firmly believes that utilising the content of digital news publishers, without consent, for AI training and subsequent generative AI applications, such as search assistance and information purposes, constitutes an infringement of copyright."

Two new GST levies may replace compensation cess, but at what cost?Health and Clean Energy levies may replace the Compensation Cess, but tax experts warn of rising compliance burdens and fresh coordination challenges.

Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai next month, sell China-made EVs: ReportTesla is set to open its first showroom in Mumbai next month and sell Model Y rear-wheel-drive SUVs shipped from Tesla's China factory as the company seeks expansion in the world's third-biggest automobile market, Bloomberg News reported.

India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

Sensex ends 1,046 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Bharti Airtel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,046.30 points to end at 82,408.17, while the NSE Nifty50 added 319.50 points to close at 25,112.40.

Is lifestyle inflation fuelling debt among India's middle class?Lifestyle inflation is no longer a silent threat. It is reshaping how India's middle class earns, spends and saves. It fuels debt, shrinks buffers and puts long-term financial goals at risk.

Planning to retire at 40? Here's what it really takesThe idea of retiring at 40 sounds almost rebellious. Stop working just when most people are hitting their career peak, and live the rest of your life on your own terms. No bosses, no Monday blues, no waiting for the weekend. But can you do it?

CA explains how Rs 80,000 per month income can beat Rs 2 lakhThe CA's insights suggest that intentional financial management is key to wealth building. A clear financial purpose can transform how resources are allocated, leading to sustainable growth.

entertainment.headline: Rajkummar Rao nervous to play Sourav Ganguly in biopic, says it's a huge responsibilityActor Rajkummar Rao opened up about playing Sourav Ganguly in his biopic on Tuesday. He said he is nervous about playing the role as it is a huge responsibility.

Raid 2 OTT release: When and where to watch Ajay Devgn's crime thrillerAjay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh's hit film 'Raid 2' is set to stream on Netflix from June 26, 2025. After earning over Rs 157 crore at the box office, the crime thriller now gears up for its digital debut.

And Just Like That's Cynthia Nixon, Kristin Davis on playing flawed women'And Just Like That' cast discusses the importance of flawed women on screen. The series highlights evolving roles and authentic representation in Indian and global contexts.

Jacqueline Fernandez honoured at Italian Global Series Festival 2025Jacqueline Fernandez received a special honour at the 2025 Italian Global Series Festival in Rimini for her remarkable contribution to cinema. She shared heartfelt moments from the event on Instagram, expressing gratitude for the international recognition.

Sana Khan's mother dies after health struggle, former actor shares emotional postSana Khan's mother, Saeeda Khan, died after a prolonged illness. The former actor shared the news on Instagram, asking fans to pray for her mother's soul.

BTS' Jimin joins Killin It Girl dance challenge. Watch viral videoBTS member Jimin posted a video of him dancing to fellow member JHope's 'Killin' It Girl' song. This is the first video the singer posted after getting discharged from the military on June 12.

Sonakshi on box office clash with Kajol: Proud our film releases alongside hersSonakshi Sinha expresses pride as her film 'Nikita Roy' releases alongside Kajol's 'Maa'. She welcomes the box office clash as a positive moment for both actresses.

Such hypocrisy: Uorfi Javed's sister Dolly slams Sufi Motiwala over abusive languageUorfi Javed's sister Dolly Javed stepped in to defend her sister over Sufi Motiwala's derogatory remarks on 'The Traitors'. Dolly questioned Sufi's hypocrisy for getting offended when people bullied him in the Prime Video reality show.

Ishaan Khatter's Europe trip with Shahid Kapoor ends. Pics scream bro goalsActor Ishaan Khatter on Tuesday shared photos from his Europe trip with actor-brother Shahid Kapoor on Instagram. Sharing the photos, the actor bid goodbye to Europe.

How Ginny & Georgia is a conversation starter on normalising therapy for parents'Ginny & Georgia' sets the premise to help Indian teenagers start tough conversations about mental health and therapy at home. The show encourages healing across generations by showing therapy as normal and necessary.
Shruti Haasan's X account hacked, actor alerts fansActor Shruti Haasan's X account got hacked earlier today. The actor warns fans of the cyberattack.

Kim Soo-hyun sues Kim Sae-ron's family over defamation caseActor Kim Soo-hyun has filed a criminal complaint against late actor Kim Sae-ron's family to clear his name and protect his reputation. This follows the late actor's ex-manager's defamation suit against another YouTuber.

Aamir Khan hosts special screening of Sitaare Zameen Par for President MurmuAamir Khan recently hosted a special screening of his sports-drama 'Sitaare Zameen Par' for President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

Arijit Singh surprises fans with virtual performance at Metro In Dino music launchSinger Arijit Singh couldn't attend the album launch of 'Metro In Dino' in Mumbai on Tuesday, but he managed to entertain his fans virtually. The singer gave a live virtual performance at the event.

Amitabh Bachchan's response to trolls accusing him of smoking weedAmitabh Bachchan gave sassy replies to trolls who reacted to his trolling about the cybercrime awareness call tune. The veteran actor was accused by a troll of smoking weed.

Vikrant Massey enjoys Spanish getaway with wife Sheetal Thakur and son. See picsVikrant Massey and Sheetal Thakur shared adorable pictures from their family holiday in Mallorca, Spain. The couple spent some fun and quality time with their baby boy.

Ajith Kumar's new look takes internet by storm. Viral picsActor Ajith Kumar took everyone by surprise with his new look. He seems to have opted for a buzz cut as he gears up for the next leg of his upcoming car race.

Fight like Sita but don't use her name: Why Janaki makes censor board uncomfortable?Who gets to carry Sita's name, and who decides that? Why has a film unsettled the censor board just because the protagonist is named Janaki? As mythology, memory and modern storytelling collide, we discuss if a woman in today's India can't reclaim her story if she's named 'Janaki' - after a Goddess who herself stands as a symbol of resilience and fighting back.

Mithoon reacts to highest-paid label: Glad fraternity is opening up to new avenuesSinger and composer Mithoon opened up about claims of demanding Rs 25 crore for an album. In an exclusive chat with India Today, the composer did not deny the claims, instead, he appreciated the industry for understanding the worth of the musicians.

general news.headline: Don't want regime change in Iran: Trump changes tune after ceasefireAfter flirting with the idea, US President Donald Trump said he doesn't want to see regime change in Iran amid its conflict with Israel because it would cause chaos.

Trump insists ceasefire is on, says Israeli jets will do 'friendly wave' to IranUS President Donald Trump, who said he brokered a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, stressed that the truce was in effect, minutes after he blamed the long-time foes for violating the agreement.

Love unrequited, woman techie tries to frame co-worker for Air India crashFuelled by a desire for revenge, Rene Joshilda allegedly embarked on a sophisticated campaign to ruin the man she was in unrequited love with, sending dozens of false bomb threats in his name.

Shubman Gill's new India hurt by old flaws as England chase 371 in Leeds winEngland vs India, 1st Test: England rode on Ben Duckett's fourth innings 149 to script their second-highest successful chase in Test cricket history. India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

How India-born engineer in B-2 bomber project ended up as China spyIndia-born engineer Noshir Gowadia, who played a key role in developing the B-2 bomber's stealth propulsion system, was sentenced to 32 years in prison for leaking classified US military secrets to China and other countries. His disclosures reportedly helped China develop stealth cruise missile technology.

Shubhanshu Shukla Ax-4 Launch: When, Where to watch LIVE streamingShubhanshu Shukla, an accomplished Indian Air Force pilot, will serve as pilot for the Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4), a landmark commercial spaceflight organised by Axiom Space in collaboration with NASA, ISRO, and the European Space Agency.

Blasts heard in Tehran minutes after Trump asks Israel not to bomb Iran Live UpdatesIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Trump that he could not 'cancel the attack' and some response was needed after he claimed that Iran violated the ceasefire.

Faded runway markings, worn-out tyres: Watchdog flags safety lapses at airportsThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation conducted surveillance of major airports and found "ineffective monitoring and inadequate rectification action on the defects" by airport authorities.

Tense truce: The fragility of the Israel-Iran ceasefireThe ceasefire agreement came after Iran's response to US airstrikes against its nuclear programme led Tehran to launch missiles towards Al Udeid air base in Qatar, the largest American military facility in the Middle East.

Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) System for Treatment of Severe Mitral RegurgitationThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Will show you beautiful sights, Udaipur man told French tourist, then raped herDuring the party, the accused approached the French woman and said, "Let's go out for a smoke and I will show you the beautiful sights around." He then took her to his flat and raped her.

Not leaping to join BJP: Shashi Tharoor defends PM praise as Congress fumesShashi Tharoor, in an article published in The Hindu on Monday, said Modi's energy, dynamism and willingness to engage remained a "prime asset" for India on the global stage but deserved greater backing.

Fight like Sita but don't use her name: Why Janaki makes censor board uncomfortable?Who gets to carry Sita's name, and who decides that? Why has a film unsettled the censor board just because the protagonist is named Janaki? As mythology, memory and modern storytelling collide, we discuss if a woman in today's India can't reclaim her story if she's named 'Janaki' - after a Goddess who herself stands as a symbol of resilience and fighting back.

Live: Iran President ready to resolve issues with US in call with Saudi Crown PrinceIsrael-Iran War News Live: The hostilities between Israel and Iran continued as Tel Aviv has now alleged that Tehran has violated the ceasefire, which both parties agreed upon earlier on Tuesday. The IDF said that Iran launched two ballistic missiles hours after the ceasefire deal. However, Iran denied the allegations of disrespecting the truce. Earlier too, Israel claimed that Iran launched continuous missile attacks despite US President Donald Trump announcing that the two countries had reached a ceasefire agreement early on Tuesday.

Trump drops the F-bomb on Iran and IsraelQuestioned about the fighting between Iran and Israel despite an announced ceasefire, a furious Donald Trump used the f-cussword. This is a rare moment when a sitting US President used the forbidden F-word in public while addressing the media.

Job scam, land mafia: What cops found after arresting Tamil actor in drugs caseThe Chennai Police, who arrested Tamil actor Srikanth on charges of drug abuse, unearthed a job scam and land grab mafia while probing the matter. The accused, Prasad, arrested following a nightclub brawl, is allegedly involved in a job racket.

Kolhapuris walk Prada ramp (without credit?), while also losing ground in IndiaCurrently a topic of discussion, thanks to Prada's Milan fashion show, Kolhapuri chappals face a bevy of challenges in their own country, with many insiders fearing that the actual craft might soon die out.

Yunus interfering in UK politics: Hasina's niece Tulip alleges smear campaignThe niece of ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, Tulip Siddiq, has accused Muhammad Yunus of carrying out a coordinated campaign to meddle in UK politics and tarnishing her reputation. Siddiq, a British MP, resigned from her ministerial post after corruption charges were levelled against her by the Yunus-led caretaker government in Bangladesh.

Kannadiga woman's 'I'm done defending Bengaluru' post sparks discussion on RedditIn the post titled "I'm a Kannadiga and I'm done defending Bengaluru. This city deserves the hate it's getting," the woman recounted a disheartening personal experience that pushed her to a breaking point.

Indian punched, stomped to death, New Zealand man pleads guilty after a yearA 28-year-old man has pleaded guilty to the brutal murder of 25-year-old Indian security guard Ramandeep Singh, who was killed in a park in Auckland, New Zealand, in 2023. Originally from Gurdaspur in Punjab, Singh moved to Auckland in 2018. He was attacked by the man and his teenage accomplice and died on the spot from his injuries. The court has scheduled sentencing for next month.
Truth about dark underarms: It's a health issue not a beauty fadBefore you reach for another "whitening cream," ask yourself: is it a skin problem or a signal from within?

Video shows US B-2 bombers taking off to strike Iran's nuclear sitesSeven B-2 stealth bombers dropped 'bunker-buster' bombs on three key Iranian nuclear facilities - Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan - as part of Operation Midnight Hammer.

How India uses underground caves to store crude oil for crisisThere's fear that Iran might try to choke the Strait of Hormuz, through which 20% of global crude oil is traded. India, however, is said to be in a pretty comfortable position. This is how India stores crude oil in underground rock caverns in Visakhapatnam, Mangalore and Padur for emergency situations.

Did Iran move 400 kg of uranium, enough to make 10 N-bombs, before US strikes?Even as Israel and Iran scramble through a shaky ceasefire brokered by the US, there are reports that Tehran may have outsmarted America and moved 400 kg of uranium, enough to make nine to 10 atomic bombs, to a secret location before the weekend bombing of its nuke sites - Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan.

sports.headline: Bazball strikes again: England stun India with another record 4th innings chaseEngland once again stunned India with a historic run chase in the first Test at Headingley, Leeds as they chased down 371 having five wickets in hand. It was for the second time that India were at the receiving end of England's batting masterclass.

Neeraj Chopra wins Gold in Ostrava Golden Spike event with best throw of 85.29mOstrava Golden Spike 2025: Two-time Olympic medalist continued his streak of finishing on the podium in competitions, winning gold in Czechia with a best effort of 85.29m. Neeraj finished ahead of Douw Smit of South Africa and Anderson Peters of Grenada.

India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

Bow down to Lord: Shardul Thakur memes go viral after double strike in Leeds TestShardul Thakur took two wickets in as many balls to revive India's fading hopes at Headingley on Day 5 of the first Test. England rode on Ben Duckett's 149 to go for the mammoth target of 371 in the series opener.

If Virat Kohli was playing in England, he would have scored runs: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain and BCCI President Sourav Ganguly feels Virat Kohli would've scored a lot of runs in the ongoing England tour, if he had continued playing Test cricket.

Mohammed Siraj fumes in frustration after Yashasvi Jaiswal drops 4th catchENG vs IND: Mohammed Siraj's fury said it all as Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped his fourth catch of the match—this time handing Ben Duckett a life on 97, compounding India's fielding woes on a tough Day 5 at Headingley.

Ben Duckett hits 4th innings century as England flaunt Bazball in LeedsEngland vs India: Ben Duckett smashed his sixth Test century to lead England's chase on Day 5 series opener. Duckett put India under immense pressure even as the visitors were trying to defend 371 at Headingley.

Tilak Varma flaunts love for Test cricket with century on County Championships debutCounty Championships 2025: Mumbai Indians batting star Tilak Varma hit a hundred on his debut for Hampshire in the prestigious first-class tournament in England. He played a patient knock, rescuing Hampshire against Essex on Tuesday.

Mohammed at one end, Krishna at the other: Shubman Gill's stump mic quipIndia Test captain Shubman Gill's quip for fast bowlers Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj from Day 5 of the first Test against England has been going viral on social media.

Headingley crowd boos India over repeated ball change plea on Day 5India's tough morning at Headingley turned tense when repeated ball-change appeals from Shubman Gill and Shardul Thakur were met with rejection — and a chorus of boos from the Leeds crowd during England's strong opening partnership.

Dilip Doshi dies: India, England players wear black armbands in Leeds tributeFormer Indian spinner Dilip Doshi passed away on June 23 at age 77. India and England players observed a minute's silence while wearing black armbands in a tribute to the spinner on Tuesday, June 24.

He played a patient knock, rescuing Hampshire against Essex on Tuesday.

Dilip Doshi dies: India, England players wear black armbands in Leeds tributeFormer Indian spinner Dilip Doshi passed away on June 23 at age 77. India and England players observed a minute's silence while wearing black armbands in a tribute to the spinner on Tuesday, June 24.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
